means: 出席
致力于，献身于
侍候，照顾
关注
出席，参加
[常用被动语态]（作为结果、情况）伴随
照顾
陪伴

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"陪同，伴随"之意
means: accompany ：既可指人也可指物。用于人时，侧重关系紧密或同时发生。
conduct ：无论用于人或物均指引导带领。
attend ：侧重主从关系，即下级对上级，学生对老师等，或表恭、服侍。
escort ：通常指用车或人在陆上伴随、护送，其目的是保护或出于礼节。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词或词组均含"参加，加入"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: attend, join, participate, take part in
means: attend ：侧重参加或出席会议或学术活动等。
join ：普通用词，指加入党派、团体或游戏活动等。
participate ：正式用词，特指参加团体活动，暗示以一个积极的角色参加。
take part in ：侧重参加某项群众性、集体性的事业、工作或活动，突出参加者在其中发挥一定的作用。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"注意"之意。
means: notice ： 指对所见所闻所感的人或事作出的反应，侧重结果。
note语气比notice强，指不仅注意到，而且记录下来，侧重注意的认真与仔细。
mind ： 指用心地去观察，了解某人或某物以达到某一目的。常用于命令句中。
attend ： 一般用词，侧重专心于某事。
remark ： 一般指经过思维活动而注意到。

sentence.Network_en: Representatives from across the horse industry will attend the meeting.
sentence.Network_cn: 整个赛马业的代表都将参加这次会议。

sentence.Network_en: Syria will attend only if the negotiations deal with issues of substance.
sentence.Network_cn: 只有在谈判涉及重大问题时叙利亚才会参加。

sentence.Network_en: All three are Chelsea fans, and attend all home games together.
sentence.Network_cn: 3个人都是切尔西队的球迷，一起观看了所有的主场比赛。

高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... positive adj 肯定的；积极的 attend vt 出席；！参加；上（大学等） △ rehearse vt 预演；排演.

niki-study blog - niki-study - 网易博客 ... 1.appointment 约会，约定 2.attendance 出席人数；出席 3.cabinet 橱柜.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (in the sense 'apply one's mind, one's energies to'): from Old French atendre, from Latin attendere, from ad- 'to' + tendere 'stretch'

encyclopedia.content: vt. 出席；上（大学等）；照料；招待；陪伴 vi. 出席；致力于；照料；照顾 attend [ə'tend] vt.出席，参加锛埢嵋榈蕊級，到；上锛埓笱У蕊級：to attend a concert 去听音乐会 to attend church 上教堂做礼拜 to attend a lecture 听讲课 [常用被动语态]锛堊魑峁⑶榭鲲級伴随；陪伴：Success attended her efforts (或 hard work). 成功随着她的努力锛埢蚺ぷ黠級而来。 Fever may attend a cold. 寒热可

entry.def: If you attend a meeting or other event, you are present at it.

example.ex: Thousands of people attended the funeral...
The meeting will be attended by finance ministers from many countries...
example.tran: 很多国家的财政部长将出席会议。

entry.def: If you attend an institution such as a school, college, or church, you go there regularly.

example.ex: They attended college together at the University of Pennsylvania.
example.tran: 他们一起就读于宾夕法尼亚大学。

entry.tran: 处理，料理（事情）；照顾，护理（受伤的人）
entry.def: If you attend to something, you deal with it. If you attend to someone who is hurt or injured, you care for them.

example.ex: The staff will helpfully attend to your needs...
example.tran: 工作人员会帮忙满足您的需求。

example.ex: There are more pressing matters to be attended to today...
example.tran: 今天有更紧急的事情要处理。

means.word_mean: 1. be present at (meetings, church services, university), etc.;

sentences.sentence: "I rarely attend services at my church"

means.word_mean: 2. take charge of or deal with;
3. to accompany as a circumstance or follow as a result;

sentences.sentence: "Menuhin's playing was attended by a 15-minute standing ovation"

means.word_mean: 4. work for or be a servant to;

sentences.sentence: "She attends the old lady in the wheelchair"
"Can you wait on our table, please?"
"The minister served the King for many years"
"The children in the audience attended the recital quietly"

auth_sentence.content: Legally, they could have been compelled to attend.
auth_sentence.res_content: Legally, they could have been compelled to attend.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Legally, they could have been compelled to attend.

auth_sentence.content: One question is whether any SNP MPs will attend.
auth_sentence.res_content: One question is whether any SNP MPs will attend.

auth_sentence.content: Sports never figured in my decision to attend Binghamton.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sports never figured in my decision to attend Binghamton.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的
stems_affixes.word_buile: intend[v.想要,打算,企图]+ed……的→adj.有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的 n.已经订婚者
intend[[v.想要,打算,企图]]拿省鷄dj.目不转睛的,热切的 n.意图

stems_affixes.value_cn: 嫩的, 温柔的, 软弱的
stems_affixes.word_buile: tend伸展,趋向+er→像伸出的幼芽→嫩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 出席, 出席的人数, 伺候, 照料
stems_affixes.word_buile: attend[v.出席,参加]+ance表名词→n.出席, 出席的人数, 伺候, 照料
attend[v.出席,参加]+ant人→n.服务员;随从,随员
intend[v.想要,打算,企图]+ed……的→adj.有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的 n.已经订婚者
intend[[v.想要,打算,企图]]拿省鷄dj.目不转睛的,热切的 n.意图
tend趋向+ency表名词→n.趋势,趋向;倾向
at加强+tend伸展,趋向→伸出去→出席
con一起+tend伸展,趋向→一起伸展→竞争,斗争

stems_affixes.value_cn: 延长,延伸;扩充;给予;提供;估价
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+tend伸展,趋向→伸出去→扩张
in内+tend伸展,趋向→内心伸出→想要

stems_affixes.value_cn: 假装,假托,借口,[在演戏中]装扮
stems_affixes.word_buile: pre预先,提前+tend伸展,趋向→提前展开,事先展开→假装,借口
pro前+tend伸展,趋向→v.[使]伸出, [使]伸展

stems_affixes.value_cn: 趋向,往往是;易于,往往会;照料,看护
stems_affixes.word_buile: tend伸展,趋向→趋向做→易于,往往会

Sentence.sentence: She's afraid she won't be able to attend your class this afternoon though.
She had a job interview to attend
She had to attend an important meeting.
He becomes an inventor and sells his inventions in order to attend the university.
She attended the supermarket's grand opening ceremony.
To enhance his credibility with the audience, Larry had brought some slides of his family attending sports events.

means.word_mean: [常用被动语态](作为结果、情况)伴随；陪伴

sentences.en: Success attended her efforts (或 hard work).
sentences.cn: 成功随着她的努力(或努力工作)而来。

means.word_mean: (作侍者或陪伴者)侍候，招待；照顾；给予帮助
陪同，伴同，陪…一起去，护送

sentences.en: I will attend you to the dance hall.

jushi.english: If you don't attend, you won't understand.
jushi.chinese: 如果你不去听,你就听不懂。

jushi.english: Why weren't you attending when I explained before?
jushi.chinese: 我以前解释的时候，你为什么不注意听呢？
